Swap between inventory views or configure the information that displays by default on the model inventory.

::: {.attn}

## Prerequisites

- [x] {{< var link.login >}}
- [x] There are models registered in the model inventory.[^1]

:::

## Swap between views

:::{.callout}
Changes are automatically saved to your account and do not affect other users.
:::

In the left sidebar, click **{{< fa cubes >}} Model Inventory**:

Table view
: - To display the inventory in table view, click **{{< fa table >}} Display Table**. 
- Columns on the table view can be customized.[^2]

Card view
: - To display the inventory in card view, click **Display Cards**. 
- By default, the model name, purpose, tier, owner, and status are displayed on each card. 

## Customize table view

:::{.callout}
Changes are automatically saved to your account and do not affect other users.
:::

Add or remove columns and customize the order the columns appear on your table view: 

1. In the left sidebar, click **{{< fa cubes >}} Model Inventory**.

2. Click **{{< fa table >}} Manage Columns** to manage column visibility and order. To use this feature, make sure you're in table view.[^3]

   You can toggle visibility for each item and drag each option to change the order:

   ![Manage Columns in the model inventory](manage-columns-demo.gif){width=90% fig-alt="An animation that shows how to manage columns in the model inventory" .screenshot}

- Available columns are determined by your model inventory fields.[^4] 
- For example, to add model stage to your table view, toggle [stage]{.smallcaps}.[^5]

Once customized, you can save a view for later application.[^6]

### Manage custom inventory views

:::{.callout}
Saved views are unique to you and do not display for other users in your organization.
:::

#### Save new inventory view

You can save custom table configurations as a view to reapply at any time:

1. Customize a table view.[^7]

    You can also apply filters or sorting before saving your view.[^8]

2. Click **{{< fa bookmark >}} Manage Views**.

3. On the Add New View modal that appears, enter your:

    - **[view name]{.smallcaps}**
    - **[descrpiption]{.smallcaps}**

4. Click **Add New View** to create your saved view.

#### Remove saved view

::: {.callout-important}
Deletion of saved views is permanent.
:::

1. In the left sidebar, click **{{< fa cubes >}} Model Inventory**.

2. Click **{{< fa bookmark >}} Manage Views**.

3. For the view you want to remove, click on **{{< fa ellipsis-vertical >}}** and select [**{{< fa trash-can >}} Remove View**]{.red}.

4. Once you confirm, the view will be deleted.
